DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Therapeutic Procedure Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator to select if treatment was given and/or procedures were performed for the adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, both treatment given and procedure performed
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes, both treatment given and procedure performed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes, both treatment given and procedure performed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yes, both treatment given and procedure performed
The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was treatment given or proced
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was treatment given or procedure performed for this adverse event
